Accept-Encoding.desc: Indicates the content encoding (usually a compression algorithm) that the client can understand

Accept-Language.desc: Indicates the natural language and locale that the client prefers

Accept.desc: Indicates which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand

Age.desc: The amount of time (in seconds) a response has been cached (in all nodes)

Alt-Svc.desc: Allows a server to direct a client to load a resource from a different server, usually to upgrade to HTTP/2 or HTTP/3

CDN-Loop.desc: Lists entities that have forwarded the request, to detect loops

Cache-Control.desc: Directives that affect the operation of caches

Content-Length.desc: The anticipated size of the request or response body, as a decimal number of octets, sent to the recipient

Content-Range.desc: For partial responses, indicates which portion of the resource is included in the response

Cookie.desc: List of cookies attached to a request

Date.desc: Time when the response was generated

Expect.desc: Expectations that need to be fulfilled by the server in order to properly handle the request

Expires.desc: Time when the response is no longer fresh

Fastly-Cachetype.desc: Describes whether the request resulted in a cache hit / miss / pass / etc

Fastly-Client.desc: Indicates that a request came from Fastly

Fastly-Cookie-Overflow.desc: Set when a cookie header is stripped because it is too large

Fastly-Debug-Digest.desc: A digest of the cache key

Fastly-Debug-Path.desc: Details of the Fastly cache servers that processed the request

Fastly-Debug-TTL.desc: Provides timing information for cached resources

Fastly-FF.desc: A list of Fastly cache nodes that have processed a request

Fastly-IO-Error.desc: Errors encountered during Image Optimizer processing

Fastly-IO-Info.desc: Information on transformations made by Image Optimizer

Fastly-IO-Warning.desc: Potential issues with Image Optimizer processing

Fastly-Key.desc: Contains a token to validate API clients

Fastly-SSL.desc: Indicates whether the client-side connection used TLS to connect to Fastly

Fastly-Stats.desc: A list of Fastly applications that a response has been transformed by

Host.desc: The authority that the request is intended for

Proxy-Authenticate.desc: A challenge that indicates the authentication scheme(s) that should be used to gain access to a resource behind a proxy server

Proxy-Authorization.desc: The credentials to authenticate a user agent to a proxy server

Surrogate-Control.desc: Alternative to Cache-Control response header for CDNs and reverse proxies

Surrogate-Key.desc: Additional, space-separated purge keys for the response

TE.desc: The transfer codings the user agent is willing to accept

Trailer.desc: Allows the sender to include additional fields at the end of chunked responses

Transfer-Encoding.desc: The codings used to form the payload body send to the recipient

Upgrade.desc: Used by the client to indicate the supported protocols to the server

Vary.desc: Adds the specified request headers to the cache key for the resource

X-Cache-Hits.desc: List indicating number of cache hits in each node

X-Cache.desc: Indicates whether the request was a HIT or a MISS

X-Compress-Hint.desc: Direct Fastly to compress a response before emitting it

X-Fastly-Imageopto-Montage.desc: Provides the ability to combine up to four images into a single image

X-Fastly-Imageopto-Overlay.desc: Provides the ability to overlay one image on top of another image

X-Forwarded-For.desc: The originating IP address of a client request

X-Forwarded-Host.desc: The originating host of a client request

X-Forwarded-Server.desc: The originating server of a client request

X-Served-By.desc: Identity of the Fastly cache servers processing the response

X-Varnish.desc: Varnish-generated transaction ID for a request or response
